page.title: 02BEMPTON'S SEA BIRDS
page.content: At the extreme north-east corner of the sector are the{chalk cliffs, } these constitute the main feature of the area as far as ecology is concerned. The cliffs rise to over four hundred feet in places. As well as attracting many visitors who come to admire the spectacular scenery, the cliffs are home for many thousands of sea birds including {gannets} ,razor-bills,puffins and guillemots. The gannets draw tens of thousands of visitors to the area each Spring and Summer because this is the only mainland colony in England. Although most of the land is privately owned, the {R.S.P.B.}do have a reserve there which is manned by a warden for part of the year.
